Text: Goals and Objectivesare the EHS objectives submitted to Phil Lowry and Mike Terraso Please make every effort to support the objectives identified in this document Implementation of these items will allow for the continued growth of ETSs commitment to the EHS function Due to recent developments I will not be traveling this week or next Thanks Bill Forwarded by William KendrickOTSEnron on PM From John Shafer AM To Phil NRON cc Michael NRON bcc William KendrickOTSEnron Subject Goals and Objectives Phil Attached are the Goals Objectives for for the ETS Environmental Health and Safety Activity Included in our Goals Objectives are all of the points related to EHS that support your goals and objectives forwarded to Stan Horton John

FW Environmental findings Koch South Texas Records ReviewAs this progresses please concentrate on spill history in excess of two years and any consent orders that apply to the assets Bill Original Message From Campbell Larry Sent Thursday May PM To Belyeu Randy Cc Kendrick William Richards Joe Subject Environmental findings Koch South Texas Records Review Randy this is a short summary of the environmental findings that were identified during the records review conducted at the Corpus Christi Koch facility offices on May st and nd of this year All environmental records which were available in the file data room at the Koch office were reviewed Assumptions were made that the environmental records were complete for all assets included in the sale Primary emphasis was placed on those environmental issues which are normally associated with a sale or purchase of assets dealing with distribution and transmission of crude oil In particular pipeline and tank farms were the most critical assets which were reviewed Based upon the data review the Koch assets were in compliance with the following Air permitting permit by rule standard expemtions recordkeeping and fee payments were documented NSPS recordkeeping and inspections for VOC control on large crude oil tanks were documented Oil Pollution ActOPA plans had been prepared and were up to date SARA compliance and reporting had been completed SPCC plans had been prepared for each site which qualified under CFR Spill reporting history and notifications to the state agency were available for review There are ongoing groundwater and soil remediation activities at one site included in the asset for sale permits for the remediation activity is in place Hazardous waste notifications annual reportings and fee payments were documented Based upon the above review there were no issues which could be identified which would be condsidered a major environmental limitation or would be a considered a major environmental liability This statement is again based upon the assumption that all environmental information was present in the data room for the assets in question It should also be stated that this analysis of Kochs environmental compliance is based upon the fact that Koch has not held back or provided false or misleading information or knowledge during their presentation or informaiton contained in the facility files Pending further development and interest of this potential purchase a recommendation is made to conduct a phase I due diligence and site visit to each location to verify findings from the records review Also due to the past history of Kochs operating practices it is recommended that contract conditions be implicitly stated that EOTT will not be held liable for discoveries of past deficiencies or releases of contamination which have occurred on any of the Koch assets purchased

Remediation Project invoice management procedure Cc the approved invoice management procedure for REMEDIATION projects associated with EPSC operations EOTT assets The procedure was developed to streamline the insurance recovery process If you have any questions please give me a call Also please forward this to any individuals that may need access to the procedure Thanks Bill

Re Expense Report Cc Forwarded by William KendrickOTSEnron on PM From Michelle Muniz PM To William NRON cc Subject Re Expense Report LOOKS GOOD From William Kendrick PM To Michelle MunizOTSEnron cc Subject Expense Report please check coding Bill Forwarded by William KendrickOTSEnron on PM Larry Campbell PM To William nron cc Subject Expense Report Bill as one of your last acts of kindness towards me before I receive your extremely generous Christmas gift in the mail would you please approve of the attached expense report If I dont see or talk to you this month may you and your family be richly blessed at the celebration of the birth of our Savour

Domestic Audit Calendar Forwarded by William KendrickOTSEnron on AM From Randy Belyeu PM To Stanley nron Dana R CT James NRON Phil NRON Dan NRON Michel NelsonET NRON Randy NRON John nron Don nron John R nron Louis SoldanoET NRON Colleen RakerET NRON Michael NRON Mike NRON Charlie NRON Allan NRON Scott NRON Ken EarlET NRON Rich JollyET NRON Dave OdnealET NRON Mark AdelmannET NRON Tom GilbertET NRON RR McGillivrayET NRON Tom MertzET NRON Ken NRON Max NRON Kenneth NRON Terry GalassiniET NRON Gary NRON Wayne NRON Mike BonnstetterET NRON William NRON David L NRON Stephen NRON Gary NRON Molly ott Gary ott Robert ott Dan L CT Steve ott Steve HPL CT Ron nron David NRON cc Don nron Chuck nron Mike nron Janice nron Terri nron Cheryl nron Frank NRON Lohit Datta nron Subject Domestic Audit Calendar Attached for your information and planning is the projected ETS audit calendar for As you can see there are a few changes in the calendar for next year This year we welcome Don Bruce to the audit program Don joins Enron Quality Management from the EOTT organization as an additional Audit Director As can be seen we have blended the EOTT assets into the ETS calendar Next year ETS will be going to a four year rotation for auditing team assets therefore we have scheduled and will be conducting fortytwo domestic audits Major changes are also happening within our program design for First five unannounced audits will be conducted giving management a picture of how well the assets are being operated on a day to day basis Also new to the program this year the audits conducted by our audit teams will be scored In January we are introducing a new electronic format to the audit process This new computerized program should greatly enhance the audit process by giving EQM the capability of Producing enhanced audit reports Generating site specific verification points formally questions Producing statistical graphs and data Scoring by category or total audit Increasing objectivity Generating historical data for review Enron Quality Management is enthuastically looking forward to and the progressive program that we have outlined to help ensure quality management of our gas and liquid facilities During this holiday season we would like to take this opportunity to extend to each of you and your families the happiest of holidays and a progressive and prosperous new year

a quick note on a statement Stan Horton made at a recent meeting with the OTS group Stan stated that the GPG was the foundation of the Enron House and that it would be difficult for Enron to keep its current bond rating without GPGs revenue
